SENT.plain: Patients with Angelman's syndrome have been reported to have ocular hypopigmentation and a number are now known to have a microdeletion of chromosome 15q 11----13

Detailed ocular examination of eight new cases revealed normal visual acuity and foveal reflexes, but a pigmentary deficiency which is limited to the choroid and iris stroma--both of neural crest origin
Patients with Prader-Willi syndrome have similar ocular features and many have a microdeletion of chromosome 15q 11----13
It is therefore possible that this region may influence neural crest development
